homes_hear_details: Utah has not yet launched its HOMES or HEAR rebate programs under the Inflation Reduction Act. The Utah Office of Energy Development is the designated state entity coordinating with the U.S. Department of Energy on program planning and implementation.

income_thresholds.low_income_80_ami: For Utah, 80% of Area Median Income varies by county. In Salt Lake County, 80% AMI for a family of four is approximately $68,100. In Utah County (Provo), it is approximately $63,300.
income_thresholds.moderate_income_150_ami: For Utah, 150% of Area Median Income varies by county. In Salt Lake County, 150% AMI for a family of four is approximately $127,700. In Utah County (Provo), it is approximately $118,700.

net_metering: Utah transitioned from traditional net metering to a new export credit rate structure in 2020. Under the current framework, Rocky Mountain Power customers with solar systems receive credit for exported energy at a rate set by the Public Service Commission, which is typically below the full retail rate. The export credit rate is reviewed periodically.

state_tax_credits.name: Utah Renewable Energy Systems Tax Credit
state_tax_credits.amount: 25% of the cost of a qualifying system, up to $1,600 for residential solar and other renewable energy systems
state_tax_credits.eligible_items: Solar photovoltaic systems, wind energy systems, geothermal systems, and other qualifying renewable energy installations on residential property
state_tax_credits.details: Utah offers a personal income tax credit for the installation of renewable energy systems. The credit applies to the cost of the system after any federal credits.

state_rebate_programs.name: Weatherization Assistance Program
state_rebate_programs.administrator: Utah Department of Workforce Services - Housing and Community Development Division
state_rebate_programs.amount: Average expenditure of approximately $7,000 per home
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Insulation, air sealing, heating system repair or replacement, windows, doors
state_rebate_programs.details: Federally funded program for income-qualifying households at or below 200% of federal poverty level. Administered through community action agencies across Utah.

programs.name: Wattsmart Residential Rebates
programs.amount: Up to $1,400 for heat pumps, $300 for insulation, $100 for smart thermostats, $300 for heat pump water heaters
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency heat pumps, central air conditioners, insulation, smart thermostats, heat pump water heaters, ENERGY STAR windows

programs.name: Home Energy Savings Program
programs.eligible_items: Comprehensive home energy evaluation with recommendations and free direct-install measures

programs.name: ThermWise Residential Rebates
programs.amount: Up to $600 for high-efficiency furnaces, $300 for water heaters, $100 for smart thermostats
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency natural gas furnaces, tankless water heaters, smart thermostats, insulation, duct sealing, windows

programs.name: ThermWise Home Energy Plan
programs.eligible_items: Home energy evaluation with personalized energy-saving recommendations

programs.name: Residential Energy Efficiency Rebates
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency HVAC, insulation, ENERGY STAR appliances
